sen.j: 神屋 宗湛（かみや そうたん、天文 (元号)20年1月1日 (旧暦)（1551年2月6日） - 寛永12年10月28日 (旧暦)（1635年12月7日））は戦国時代 (日本)から江戸時代前期にかけての博多の豪商。
sen.e: Sotan KAMIYA (February 6, 1551 - December 7, 1635) was the wealthy merchant in Hakata during the Sengoku period (period of warring states) to the early Edo period.
Sotan KAMIYA (February 6, 1551 - December 7, 1635) was a wealthy merchant in Hakata during the Sengoku (Warring States) period and into the early Edo period.
Sotan KAMIYA (February 16, 1551 - December 7, 1635) was a wealthy merchant in Hakata during the Sengoku period (Period of Warring States) and the early Edo period.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。グレゴリオ暦に訂正しました。Sengoku period (Period of Warring States)に訂正しました。

sen.j: 神屋氏の第6代当主。
sen.e: The sixth family head of the Kamiya clan.
He was the sixth family head of the Kamiya clan.
He was the sixth head of the Kamiya clan.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 出家前の諱は貞清。
sen.e: His imina (personal name) before becoming a priest was Sadakiyo.
His imina (personal name) before becoming a priest was Sadakiyo.
His personal name before becoming a priest was Sadakiyo.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 「神谷」は誤り。
sen.e: 神谷' was wrong kanji (Chinese characters) for Kamiya.
神谷' are incorrect kanji (Chinese characters) for Kamiya.
神谷' are incorrect kanji (Chinese characters) for Kamiya.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 宗湛以前からすでに神屋氏は豪商としての地位を築いていた。
sen.e: The Kamiya clan had already established their status as the wealthy merchant before Sotan became the family head.
The Kamiya clan had already achieved status as wealthy merchants before Sotan became the family head.
The Kamiya clan had already achieved status as wealthy merchants before the period of Sotan.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 曽祖父の神屋寿貞は石見銀山の本格的開発に携わった人物であった。
sen.e: His great-grandfather, Jutei KAMIYA, was involved in full-scale development of Iwami Ginzan Silver Mine.
His great-grandfather, Jutei KAMIYA, had been involved in the full-scale development of the Iwami Ginzan silver mine.
His great-grandfather, Jutei KAMIYA, had been involved in the full scale development of the Iwami Ginzan silver mine.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 天正10年（1582年）、宗湛は島井宗室と共に上洛して時の天下人・織田信長に謁見した。
sen.e: In 1582, he went up to the capital (Kyoto) with Soshitsu SHIMAI and had an audience with Nobunaga ODA, tenkabito (person becoming the ruler of the country) of the time.
In 1582, he went up to the capital (Kyoto) with Soshitsu SHIMAI and had an audience with Nobunaga ODA, who was then the tenkabito (person becoming the ruler of the country).
In 1582, he went up to the capital (Kyoto) with Soshitsu SHIMAI and had an audience with Nobunaga ODA, who was the then ruler of the country.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 宗湛は信長の保護を得ることで、当時九州で日の出の勢いで勢力を拡大していた島津氏を抑えるとともに、豪商としての地位をさらに極めようとした。
sen.e: Sotan tried to control Shimazu clan who were extending their influence in the ascendant in Kyushu region at that time and enhance his position as the wealthy merchant by having Nobunaga's protection.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Sotan tried to control the Shimazu clan, which was extending its influence in the ascendancy of the Kyushu region at that time, as well as to enhance his position as a wealthy merchant by having Nobunaga's protection.

Sotan tried to control the Shimazu clan, which was extending its influence in the ascendant in Kyushu at that time, as well as to enhance his position as a wealthy merchant by having Nobunaga's protection.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: しかし、同年6月に本能寺の変が起こって信長が死去したため、これは失敗に終わった。
sen.e: However, it failed since Nobunaga died due to the Honnoji Incident in June, 1582.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, the effort proved to be in vain when Nobunaga died as a result of the Honnoji Incident of June 1582.
However, the effort proved to be in vain when Nobunaga died in the Honnoji Incident of June 1582.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 天正14年（1586年）、再度上洛して今度は畿内の諸大名や堺市の大商人・津田宗及らと親交を深めた。
sen.e: In 1586, he went up to the capital (Kyoto) again and developed the deep personal relationship with territorial lords and Sogyu TSUDA, who was the wealthy merchant in Osaka.
In 1586, he went to the capital (Kyoto) again and developed deep personal relationships with territorial lords and Sogyu TSUDA, who was the wealthy merchant in Osaka.
In 1586, he went to the capital (Kyoto) again and developed close personal relationships with territorial lords and Sogyu TSUDA, who was the wealthy merchant in Sakai City.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 同年、大徳寺にて出家し、宗湛と号した。
sen.e: In the same year, he became a priest in Daitoku-ji Temple and called himself Sotan.
During the same year, he became a priest of Daitoku-ji Temple and called himself Sotan.
During the same year, he became a priest at Daitoku-ji Temple and took the Buddhist name Sotan.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 天正15年（1587年）、信長死後に天下人となった豊臣秀吉に謁見した。
sen.e: In 1587, he had an audience with Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI who became tenkabito after Nobunaga's death.
In 1587 he had an audience with Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, who had become tenkabito following the death of Nobunaga.
In 1587 he had an audience with Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, who had become the ruler of the country following the death of Nobunaga.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 宗湛は秀吉に気に入られ、豪商としての特権を与えられて以後は博多商人の第一人者として栄華を極めた。
sen.e: Hideyoshi liked Sotan, so Hideyoshi gave him the privilege as the wealthy merchant and Sotan was at the height of its prosperity as the leading expert among merchants in Hakata.
Hideyoshi liked Sotan, so he gave him the privilege of a wealthy merchant's status; thus Sotan was at the height of prosperity as the leading expert among merchants in Hakata.
Hideyoshi liked Sotan, so he gave him the privilege of a wealthy merchant's status; thus Sotan was at the height of prosperity as the leading merchant in Hakata.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 秀吉の九州征伐においても、それを資金的に援助している。
sen.e: Sotan supported Hideyoshi financially on the Kyushu Conquest.
Sotan supported Hideyoshi financially in the Kyushu Conquest.
Sotan financially supported Hideyoshi in the Kyushu Conquest.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 文禄元年（1592年）から始まった朝鮮出兵においても後方兵站の補給役を務め、晩年の秀吉の側近として活躍した。
sen.e: On Japan's Invasion of Korea started in 1592, he served as a supplying role of logistical support and was active as a close adviser of Hideyoshi in his later years.
Upon the start of Japan's invasion of Korea in 1592, he served as a provider of logistical support and was active as a close adviser to Hideyoshi in his later years.
Upon the start of Japan's invasion of Korea in 1592, he served as a provider of logistical support and was active as a close adviser to Hideyoshi in his later years.

sen.j: しかし慶長3年（1598年）に秀吉が病死すると、その後に天下人となった徳川家康からは冷遇された。
sen.e: However, when Hideyoshi died by disease in 1598, Sotan was discriminated by Hideyoshi who became tenkabito afterward.
However, when Hideyoshi died of an illness in 1598, Sotan suffered discrimination by Hideyoshi, who had become the tenkabito.
However, when Hideyoshi died of an illness in 1598, Sotan suffered discrimination by Ieyasu, who had become the ruler of the country.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: そして関ヶ原の戦いの後に黒田長政が移封されると、宗湛は天下の大商人から黒田氏の御用商人にまで成り下がった。
sen.e: When Nagamasa KURODA was transferred to another domain after the Battle of Sekigahara, Sotan fell to the level of goyo-shonin (chartered merchants) of the Kuroda clan from the top wealthy merchant in the country.

When Nagamasa KURODA was transferred to another domain after the Battle of Sekigahara, Sotan, who had once been the country's wealthiest merchant, fell to the level of goyo-shonin (chartered merchant) of the Kuroda clan.

When Nagamasa KURODA was transferred to another domain after the Battle of Sekigahara, Sotan, who had once been the country's wealthiest merchant, fell to the level of chartered merchant of the Kuroda clan.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 彼自身も老齢ということもあって、以後は豪商としての活躍も無く、寛永12年（1635年）10月28日に83歳で病死した。
sen.e: He was not active as the wealthy merchant afterward as he reached old age and died by disease at the age of eighty three on December 7, 1635.
He would no longer be active as a merchant because he had reached old age; he died of an illness at the age of 83 on December 7, 1635.
He was no longer active as a merchant as he reached old age; he died of an illness at the age of 83 on December 7, 1635.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 墓所は福岡市の妙楽寺。
sen.e: His graveyard is in Myoraku-ji Temple in Fukuoka City.
His grave is located at Myoraku-ji Temple, in Fukuoka City.
His grave is located at Myoraku-ji Temple, in Fukuoka City.

sen.j: 宗湛の著作として『宗湛日記』がある。
sen.e: The "Sotan Diary" was one of his literary works.
The "Sotan Diary" was one of his literary works.
The "Sotan Diary" was one of his literary works.

sen.j: これは宗湛が秀吉時代に活躍したことをまとめた茶会記である。
sen.e: It was the Chakaiki (Record of chanoyu gatherings) which described his activities during Hideyoshi period.
It was the chakaiki (record of chanoyu gatherings) that described his activities during the Hideyoshi period.
It was the record of tea ceremony gatherings that described his activities during the Hideyoshi period.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 後世の偽書とも疑われるが、秀吉政権の内部を知る上では貴重な史書の一つともされる。
sen.e: It was suspected as gisho (apocryphal book) created in later generations, but it was one of precious historical books to learn inside of the Hideyoshi Government.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It was suspected to be a gisho (apocryphal book) created in later generations, but it was one of the precious historical books through which one could explore the workings of the Hideyoshi government.
It was suspected to be a forgery created in later generations, but it was one of the precious historical books through which one could explore the workings of the Hideyoshi government.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: また津田宗及の『天王寺屋会記』、今井宗久の『今井宗久茶湯書抜』、松屋久政の『松屋会記』と並ぶ四大茶会記ともされる。
sen.e: It was one of the four major Chakaiki along with "The Tennojiya Kaiki" by Sogyu TSUDA, "Imai Sokyu Chanoyu Nukigaki" by Sokyu IMAI, and 'Matsuya Kaiki" by Hisamasa MATSUYA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It was one of the four major chakaiki along with "The Tennojiya Kaiki," by Sogyu TSUDA, "Imai Sokyu Chanoyu Nukigaki," by Sokyu IMAI, and 'Matsuya Kaiki," by Hisamasa MATSUYA.

It was one of the four major records of tea ceremony gatherings along with "The Tennojiya Kaiki," by Sogyu TSUDA, "Imai Sokyu Chanoyu Nukigaki," by Sokyu IMAI, and 'Matsuya Kaiki," by Hisamasa MATSUYA.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。
